intro: Columnea lepidocaula, commonly known as the silverleaf columnea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant produces opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in a dense layer of silvery-white hairs, giving it its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and showy blooms. Columnea lepidocaula is relatively easy to care for, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
